channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft exec tells staff there won’t be an Amazon-style return-to-office mandate unless productivity drops
item.description: The software and cloud-computing giant currently allows employees remotely, with many new hires promised the flexibility of working from home at least...

item.title: Adams Accuses Prosecutors of Leaking Investigation Details to News Media
item.description: In a court filing Tuesday morning, lawyers for Mayor Eric Adams asked a judge to hold a hearing about what they said were grand jury secrecy violation...

item.title: Discover’s CIO says AI in financial services is still in the ‘early stages’ as the industry navigates 2 risks
item.description: Gen AI will eventually be a "very robust enabler" in financial services, says Jason Strle of Discover Financial Services.

item.title: Pizza Hut is giving away 1 million free pizzas
Tim Walz’s leadership resonates with my country’s Viking Code. Here’s why that matters

item.title: Mexico’s First Female President Takes Office
item.description: A climate scientist and former mayor, Claudia Sheinbaum will be inaugurated on Tuesday as the first woman to lead the country.

item.title: The cost of heating your home could soar this winter
item.description: National Energy Assistance Directors Association forecast could make your wallet ache.

item.title: We May Be Moments from a Ballistic Missile War in the Mideast
item.description: And this one could involve the United States.

item.title: Live Updates: Iran Plans to Attack Israel in the Coming Hours, U.S. and Israel Say
item.description: A U.S. official said the United States was preparing to help defend Israel against an attack. Earlier, Israeli forces launched a ground invasion of so...

item.title: The Vance-Walz Debate: Four Columnists Brace for Impact
item.description: With Harris and Trump locked in a tight race, will the vice-presidential debate do anything to help or hurt either ticket?

item.title: Port Strike Begins on East and Gulf Coasts
item.description: Members of the International Longshoremen’s Association walked out for the first time since 1977 in a standoff over wages, benefits and job security.

item.title: Behind NYC School Bus Mess, a 45-Year-Old Contract That’s Hard to Change
item.description: Students across New York City are waiting up to an hour for school buses as a driver shortage and conflict over a contract hamstring the city’s abilit...

item.title: Typhoon Krathon Nears Taiwan After Lashing the Philippines
item.description: The storm is expected to bring torrential rain this week to Taiwan’s south, including Kaohsiung, the island’s third-largest city.

item.title: Map: Israel’s Ground Invasion of Southern Lebanon
item.description: While details of the operation are scarce, Israel has ordered residents of many southern towns to move north.

item.title: 3 Children Injured, One Seriously, in Zurich Stabbing Attack
item.description: The police in Switzerland’s largest city said they had arrested a 23-year-old man after a midday stabbing attack.
